questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about how if-then rules are processed during an inferencing session?

discussion.content: C. The effective date set for a rule can take it out of consideration for evaluation.

choices.D: A priority setting of 1 will cause the rule to fire during each inferencing session.
choices.B: A particular rule can be fired only once in an inferencing session.
choices.C: The effective date set for a rule can take it out of consideration for evaluation.
choices.E: Rules with multiple IF conditions receive higher priority during evaluation.
choices.A: Rules are evaluated in the order in which they were added to the ruleset.

choices.C: performance per participant on a standard dashboard
choices.B: workload per participant on a standard dashboard
choices.A: workload per process on a standard dashboard

discussion.content: C. performance per participant on a standard dashboard

questions.question_text: Which dashboard should you use to gauge the overall efficiency of a user for a specific process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
A. An existing Java web service is made available to clients running transports and protocols not originally planned by the original developers. No modifications to the web service implementation are required.
✅ OSB enables protocol translation and transport mediation without modifying the backend service.

B. A request is transformed and routed to an appropriate service endpoint based on the content of the request message. All complexity of the supporting runtime protocol selection is hidden.
✅ OSB supports dynamic routing and message transformation based on content.

E. A request for a background check is conditionally routed between multiple third-party validation services with different service-level agreements. Remediation must be handled if any one fails.
✅ OSB allows conditional routing and supports SLA enforcement, ensuring that requests are handled based on predefined agreements.

A."An existing Java web service is made available to clients running transports and protocols not originally
 planned by the original developers. No modifications to the web service implementation are required."
C. "A request for a large graphics job is split into smaller pieces that are processed in parallel by an
 existing rendering service. After all of the pieces have been processed, the results are joined to create a
 single response."
D. A request containing a complex family tree is validated before being routed to an existing genealogy service. Recursive logic is implemented to validate that all relationships in the tree are consistent.

choices.E: A request for a background check is conditionally routed between multiple third-party validation services with different service-level agreements. Remediation
choices.A: An existing Java web service is made available to clients running transports and protocols not originally planned by the original developers. No modifications to the web service implementation are required.
choices.D: A request containing a complex family tree is validated before being routed to an existing genealogy service. Recursive logic is implemented to validate that all relationships in the tree are consistent.
choices.C: A request for a large graphics job is split into smaller pieces that are processed in parallel by an existing rendering service. After all of the pieces have been processed, the results are joined to create a single response.
choices.B: A request is transformed and routed to an appropriate service endpoint based on the content of the request message. All complexity of the supporting runtime protocol selection is hidden

questions.question_text: Which three are proper applications of Oracle Service Bus?

You defined an event. You now want to trigger that event from an existing Mediator component.
How do you link the event to the Mediator so that the Mediator can raise the event to the Event Delivery Network (EDN)?

choices.B: Use a text editor to modify the .edlfile that defines the event so that the Mediator is identified as a publisher.
choices.D: Use Enterprise Manager to associate the Mediator with the appropriate event.
choices.A: Use the SOA composite editor to specify the event as a property on the incoming wire into the Mediator component.
choices.C: Use the SOA Composite Editor to add a raise action to the Mediator’s .mplan specification file.

discussion.content: C. Use the SOA Composite Editor to add a raise action to the Mediator’s .mplan specification file.

questions.question_text:
For each enrollment request message, a health insurance carriers web service always returns a response message acknowledgement the receipt of the enrollment request. If there are problems fulfilling the requested enrollment, the web service may respond at a later time with an additional response message detailing why the enrollment could not be fulfilled.
Which Oracle SOA Suite service component should be used to implement this integration pattern?

discussion.content: Asyncronous BPEL Process could do the job nicely. Don't see how a mediator could do it
